titleInfo.title: Egypt. Karnak. The entrance Pylon of the Karnak Temple.

mods.abstract: Gateway of Ptolemy III, Euergetes I at Karnak, East Thebes (Ptolemaic Period); monumental gateway with rows of incised images of Ptolemy III wearing different crowns and giving offerings to Horus, Isis, and Osiris, row of repeated theme below cracked cornice and lintel adorned with the winged sun disk; man on donkey poses between pillars of gateway, two figures in shadows near a copse of palm trees (right); ruins of Temple and palm trees (background); "(copyright) Publisher's Photo Service, Inc. 541. Egypt. Karnak. The entrance Pylon of the Karnak Temple." in black along bottom; "39147." in white along bottom at right corner of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

name.namePart: Ptolemy III Euergetes, King of Egypt, -221 B.C.

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
